datafield.subfield: Study of Shear Behavior of Homogeneous and Heterogeneous Granular Materials by Experimentation and Numerical Simulation of Triaxial Test

This research aims at studying the shear behavior of homogeneous and heterogeneous granular materials by the triaxial test. The research work is performed on glass beads both in laboratory tests and by numerical simulations in DEM. The experimental tests are firstly performed on mono-disperses beads, then expanded to heterogeneous cases like bi-disperses mixtures. For numerical simulations, a cylindrical rigid wall boundary condition, based on Lamé formula is implemented, and a series of procedures is proposed to simulate the conventional triaxial test in similar conditions to experimental tests. The numerical and experimental results are compared for both mono-disperses and bi-disperses cases. The numerical model can reproduce deviatoric curves satisfactorily in all experimental conditions.
